meanings.definition: To undermine the power or authority of (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: The villain was subverting the king's rule by spreading lies.
meanings.sent2: The rebels were subverting the government to bring about change.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was subverting the bird feeder by stealing all the seeds.
meanings.sent4: The hacker was subverting the security system with ease.
meanings.sent5: The weeds were subverting the growth of the flowers in the garden.

meanings.definition: To disrupt or overthrow (an established system or institution)
meanings.sent1: The protestors were subverting the unfair laws through peaceful demonstrations.
meanings.sent2: The revolution aimed at subverting the oppressive regime.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous students were subverting the school's dress code with creative outfits.
meanings.sent4: The storm was subverting the calm of the peaceful town.
meanings.sent5: The virus was subverting the functioning of the computer system.

meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer was subverting the pure magic for his own dark purposes.
meanings.sent2: The temptation of power was subverting his moral compass.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy was subverting the neatness of the living room by scattering toys everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The toxic environment was subverting the team's unity.
meanings.sent5: The negative thoughts were subverting her confidence.
